messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Tsuba Kanshoki 2nd Edition
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rich, thanks for the tip, this book is huge and heavy. I may look for Tsuba Taikan next then. cheers Rich Yes, Tsuba Kanshoki is excellent. Be careful of
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rich, thanks for the tip, this book is huge and heavy. I may look for Tsuba Taikan next then.

cheers

Rich

Yes, Tsuba Kanshoki is excellent. Be careful of the binding.
Being a heavy book, the back tends to break rather easily.
For you next tsuba book, I'd suggest the Tsuba Taikan.

Rich S

------------------------------------------------------------
Richard Stein, PhD alchemyst@...

The Japanese Sword Index
http://www.geocities.com/alchemyst/nihonto.htm
------------------------------------------------------------

messages.subject: Tsuba Kanshoki 2nd Edition
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I just picked up a copy of Tsuba Kanshoki ( 2nd Edition ) form Alan Bale after Jim G recommended it to me and it is absolutly fantastic. If folk like
messages.messageBody:
Hi all, I just picked up a copy of Tsuba Kanshoki ( 2nd Edition ) form Alan Bale after Jim G recommended it to me and it is absolutly fantastic. If folk like Sasano's Sukashi book they'll love this. Anyway, book rant over, Thanks Jim for the recommendation and thanks Alan for the great book/price.

Cheers all

Rich

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
